wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Wing Gray (1845 – 23 November 1920) was a Farmer and a British Conservative Party politician.
He was the Member of Parliament for Maldon in Essex from 1886 to 1892.From 1885 to 1890 he served as a captain in the 2nd Volunteer Battalion of the Essex Regiment.

response: * Charles Wing Gray (1845–1920), British Member of Parliament for Maldon, 1886–1892

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1886 United Kingdom general election

response: The Unionists chose Charles Wing Gray, an Essex farmerThe Times, 11 October 1900 p8 whose home was at Halstead. Gray had twice contested the seat before. At the 1895 election he had reduced the Liberal majority from 1,881 to 425 and in 1900 he had brought it down to just 110. He had continued working locally to try and eliminate it altogether and must have had high hopes of victory at the by-election. Saffron Walden had at this time a reputation as a town with strong Quaker influences and a prominent member of the Society of Friends, E B Gibson, was one of Gray's nominators.
